children.subject: IMO CS161 is way more practical since the TCP/networking/security aspect of it is something you always have to consider when building large scale applications. So please drop CS186 so I can get off the waitlist

history.content:
I'd say 186 is more practical for a few reasons.

1) Almost every application uses some sort of database. Knowing how to query one is an absolute requirement, but knowing how it is built is also extremely useful in using the database optimally. 

2) Databases is still a huge (and growing) field. Many companies are building custom data stores and new database startups are constantly popping up.

3) Most important: The concepts you learn in a database class are applicable to other systems as well, not just databases. The last two summers I've worked on applications that were not databases, but I've found what I learned in 186 to be very useful. I haven't found the same in 161.

IMO a lot of the concepts in 161 are not as applicable to other kinds of development if you aren't specifically working in security. (1) Buffer overflows aren't a thing if you're using a safe language. (2) Web security isn't a problem if you're not using web. (3) Unless you have a PhD you aren't coming up with new crypto schemes and most major languages have excellent libraries for these already built. Additionally, the mathy stuff you learn from crypto isn't easily applicable to other fields.

That being said, I found 161 extremely interesting. I thought it had the best projects of any CS class I've taken and I strongly recommend taking it if you have time.

That being said, I found 161 extremely interesting. I thought it had the best projects of any CS class I've taken and I strongly recommend taking it if you have time.

children.subject: In 161 right now so can't comment on it, but I will say that while 186 was very boring, it has also been very useful.

history.content:
how do 161 and 186 compare in time spent on projects, as well as difficulty? I can only take one this semester..

My concern is the first project/homework of 186 is sort of boring, but I have heard that class is practical to interviews and gets better. Would love to hear other thoughts?
history.subject: difficulty and practicality in 161 vs. 186
